description: '''Genge music''' is a genre of [[hip hop music|hip-hop music]] influenced by [[dancehall music|dancehall]], originating from [[Nairobi]], [[Kenya]] in the 1990s. The term "[[Gengetone Music|Genge]]" was coined by producer [[Clemo]] and popularized by Kenyan rappers [[Jua Cali]] and [[Nonini]] at [[Calif Records]]. The genre is commonly performed in [[Sheng slang|Sheng]], a mixture Swahili, English and various local dialects. The word "Genge" itself comes from [[Sheng slang]], meaning "a group or a mass of people."
